definition: to be full of (emotion)/to brim with (love, tears etc)
to keep/to contain/to suck (keep in your mouth without chewing)

sentences.english: His eyes filled with tears as he looked lovingly at her.
sentences.chinese: 他饱含深情地望着她时，眼里充满了泪水。

sentences.english: Yes , good food and good service .
sentences.chinese: 很好，饱含和服务都很好。

sentences.english: The life of the monochrome portrait contains a rich history dating back to the birth of photography itself.
sentences.chinese: 黑白画像的生命饱含历史，追溯到摄影诞生之时。

sentences.english: All Van Gogh's pictures from this time became biographical notes loaded with meaning.
sentences.chinese: 梵高在这段时期的作品都是饱含寓意的自传式笔记。

sentences.english: Controversy is, of course, part of the appeal.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这些申请中还是饱含争议的。

sentences.english: First, the carbon cloth goes into the mould dry, rather than pre-impregnated with resin.
sentences.chinese: 第一，碳织物进入模具时是干的，而非事先饱含树脂。

sentences.english: Her eyes filled with tears of joy.
sentences.chinese: 她的眼眶里饱含着幸福的热泪。

sentences.english: With tears that tell of broken dreams.
sentences.chinese: 饱含的泪水讲述的是一个个破碎的迷梦。

sentences.english: She pitifully looked at me, with the eyes in which the hot tears stood.
sentences.chinese: 她可怜地望着我，两眼饱含热泪。

sentences.english: Did not expect this to Fang Zhenmin full of hostility against outsiders.
sentences.chinese: 未料，这个地方镇民对外来者饱含敌意。

sentences.english: The history of the evolution of Yangzhou Pinghua's accents records both positive and negative experience.
sentences.chinese: 扬州评话语音演变的历史饱含正反两面经验。

sentences.english: Flatterer, " she said giving him a mock reproving look."
sentences.chinese: “马屁精，”她饱含嘲弄和责备地看了他一眼，说道。

sentences.english: Each song melodies are full of the sons and daughters of the deepest love.
sentences.chinese: 每曲旋律都饱含着儿女最深沉的爱。

sentences.english: Indeed, there is so much humanity and purity about hard work.
sentences.chinese: 确实，艰苦工作饱含着人性与纯洁。

sentences.english: This saturation of the sense of responsibility gives Longchou a more tenacious vitality.
sentences.chinese: 这饱含责任感的产品，赋予了龙洲更加顽强的生命力。

sentences.english: What I've discovered is that in art, as in music, there's a lot of truth-and then there's a lie.
sentences.chinese: 艺术，正如音乐，是饱含真实的。

definition: to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
to hold in store/to contain (untapped reserves etc)
to have one's heart filled with/(to collide) full on/(of farm animals) heavy with young
to contain in a concealed form/to keep covered up/implicit
to be full to overflowing/to be brimming over with
between the words and the lines (idiom); implied meaning/connotations
